channel.title: 0x10c, notch's new game
channel.description:
[center][img]http://0x10c.com/logo.png[/img]
http://0x10c.com/[/center]
Simply put, it's a game, by notch (creator of Minecraft), where you have spaceships (like EVE Online) and you control them by programming them with a primitive language called Assembly. What I believe notch expects is a community to pop up around this, where people buy/trade ships and software and general space-piracy occurs. I expect it will be quite open-ended and player-driven.
Various people have been busy on working on emulators for the game's ship's 16bit CPU architecture and planning out various things to aid in-game development. Each ship will have a programmable virtual CPU of it's own. The general entry-bar to the game looks like it's aimed at a more mature, technically-adept crowd than Minecraft was, as learning to program will probably be a necessity if you want to get far into the game and the learning curve will probably be steep because of this.
For more information, check [url=https://twitter.com/#!/notch]notch's twitter[/url]. General discussions are on [url=http://www.reddit.com/r/programming/comments/rsxng/dcpu16_spec_is_out_for_notchs_0x10c_game_who/]reddit[/url] (It also [url=http://www.reddit.com/r/dcpu_16_programming]has a subreddit, /r/dcpu_16_programming[/url]) and [url=http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=3797036]HackerNews[/url].
If you want get a bit of a head-start by experimenting with the language that the spaceships will use and have a bit of assembly programming knowledge already, I recommend reading the [url=http://0x10c.com/doc/dcpu-16.txt]CPU specification[/url] and download [url=https://bitbucket.org/interfect/dcpu-emu]interfect's assembler and emulator[/url]. I expect more tools will pop up over the next week or so, since it's still early days. Plans are being made for potential programming with BASIC dialects, Pascal, C etc.
So, what do y'all think?
random relevant links: [url=http://www.reddit.com/r/0x10c/]general reddit discussion of the game[/url] [url=http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/1138612-0x10c-new-game-by-notch]minecraft forum discussion[/url] [url=http://techcrunch.com/2012/04/04/0x10c-minecraft-developer-notchs-next-game-will-be-a-mmo-space-epic/]techcrunch overview[/url]

item.title: 0x10c, notch's new game
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:43, topic:438490”]I don’t know if I just gravedug but oh well.
I understand what Notch is trying to do but I do think that he’s making a bit too difficult.
He could make a mini language himself (not even a language, but it would be like command lines with parameters such as rs commands).
That would make it easier for the players to learn than an actual programming language…
I don’t know Assembly myself but I would definately learn it just for this game ^^[/quote]

He did make a mini language, it’s called DASM.

Read full topic

item.title: 0x10c, notch's new game
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

I don’t know if I just gravedug but oh well.
I understand what Notch is trying to do but I do think that he’s making a bit too difficult.
He could make a mini language himself (not even a language, but it would be like command lines with parameters such as rs commands).
That would make it easier for the players to learn than an actual programming language…
I don’t know Assembly myself but I would definately learn it just for this game ^^

item.title: 0x10c, notch's new game
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

reyx7:

How hard is the language? Like on a scale of html to malbolge, where would it go?

this is fibonacci number code in MASM syntax(source wikipedia)

fib:
    mov edx, [esp+8]
    cmp edx, 0
    ja @f
    mov eax, 0
    ret
    
    @@:
    cmp edx, 2
    ja @f
    mov eax, 1
    ret
    
    @@:
    push ebx
    mov ebx, 1
    mov ecx, 1
    
    @@:
        lea eax, [ebx+ecx]
        cmp edx, 3
        jbe @f
        mov ebx, ecx
        mov ecx, eax
        dec edx
    jmp @b
    
    @@:
    pop ebx
    ret

Read full topic

item.title: 0x10c, notch's new game
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:28, topic:438490”][quote author=_s link=topic=541207.msg3964623#msg3964623 date=1333584561]

[quote author=ox random xi link=topic=541207.msg3964609#msg3964609 date=1333584114]

I already am talking to people about starting clans for this, oh boy this will be interesting. Notch better not fuck this up like he fucked Minecraft up.

Does sini know assembly?
[/quote]i would question him knowing Java let alone something as nasty as good ole assembly

I already am talking to people about starting clans for this, oh boy this will be interesting. Notch better not fuck this up like he fucked Minecraft up.

Does sini know assembly?

Nope. But this gives me a perfectly good reason to learn it.

In my opinion, learning it for a game that’s going to require a subscription, not worth it. but I do see this as an actual cool way to learn a legitimate language, it could be interesting.
[/quote]i might write a BASIC to DCPU16 compiler sometime so you don’t have to learn such a nasty thing.

MOV cliff, me PUSH me

so, _s knows assembly? why… lol[/quote]mainly because of operating system development, it was kind of essential

[quote=“sinisoul, post:29, topic:438490”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=541207.msg3964630#msg3964630 date=1333584732]

[quote author=_s link=topic=541207.msg3964623#msg3964623 date=1333584561]

In my opinion, learning it for a game that’s going to require a subscription, not worth it. but I do see this as an actual cool way to learn a legitimate language, it could be interesting.

so, _s knows assembly? why… lol

kyle knows many things but his laziness keeps him from using it to do anything worth while[/quote]if i harmed your ego that badly by saying you don’t know Java it would benefit your case to be direct about it. i predict that you haven’t seen some recent projects of mine.
